  • Method Details

    • isProfilerEnabledForThisThread

      public static boolean isProfilerEnabledForThisThread()
      Returns:
      true if the Profiler is enabled for this thread; false otherwise.

    • pop

      public static void pop(ProfilerFrame profilerFrame)
      Pops all the frames up to and including the given frame off the current ProfilerStack. If the given frame does not exist in the current ProfilerStack, nothing happens.
      Parameters:
      profilerFrame - The frame to pop.

    • peek

      public static ProfilerFrame peek()
      Returns:
      The topmost ProfilerFrame on the current ProfilerStack, or the empty profiler frame is the Profiler is not enabled for this thread

    • push

      public static ProfilerFrame push(ProfilerTag tag)
      Under certain circumstances, pushes a new ProfilerFrame onto the current thread's ProfilerStack, which is created if necessary.

      Creates a new ProfilerStack if necessary (i.e. if a push needs to be performed and there is no current stack).

      Returns:
      the ProfilerFrame pushed onto the stack, or an instance of EmptyProfilerFrame otherwise.

    • enterProfiling

      public static ProfilerFrame enterProfiling(ProfilerTag entryPoint, String entryPointDetail, boolean hiResTime, boolean allowStackTraceTracking, boolean queryOptimizerTracing, boolean extendedQueryTracing, int dbmsCounterThresholdMs, boolean diffDbmsCounters)
      Sets up the current thread for profiling, i.e. sets up a thread local stack
      Returns:
      The top-level frame. Do not call pop() on this; it will be implicitly popped when calling exitProfiling().

    • exitProfiling

      public static ProfilerStack exitProfiling()
      Clears out the stack for the current thread

    • maybeProfileBlock

      public static void maybeProfileBlock(boolean profile, ProfilerTag entryPointTag, String entryPointDetail, boolean hiResTime, boolean allowStackTraceTracking, boolean queryOptimizerTracing, boolean extendedQueryTracing, int dbmsCounterThresholdMs, boolean diffDbmsCounters, ProfilerStackHolder stackHolder, GWRunnable block) throws Exception
      Conditionally profiles the given block
      Parameters:
      profile - Whether to profile or not
      entryPointTag -
      allowStackTraceTracking -
      queryOptimizerTracing -
      extendedQueryTracing -
      dbmsCounterThresholdMs -
      diffDbmsCounters -
      stackHolder - out parameter to return the profiler stack, even if the block throws an exception
      block - @return If profile was true, returns the stack. Null otherwise.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • createPotentiallyProfiledRunnable

      public static GWRunnable createPotentiallyProfiledRunnable(ProfilerTag entryPointTag, String entryPointDetail, GWRunnable block)
      Creates a new runnable that is profiled if the current thread is profiled. The caller is responsible for ensuring all spawned threads terminate before calling exitProfiling() in the parent thread. If the returned runnable is not invoked, there is no effect on the system. The stack for the spawned thread will be returned by ProfilerStack.getSpawnedStacks(). If the returned runnable is invoked in the same thread, an exception will be thrown by the Profiler.
      Parameters:
      entryPointTag -
      block -
      Returns:
      The new runnable

    • createPotentiallyProfiledCallable

      public static <V> Callable<V> createPotentiallyProfiledCallable(ProfilerTag entryPointTag, String entryPointDetail, Callable<V> block)
      Creates a new callable that is profiled if the current thread is profiled. The caller is responsible for ensuring all spawned threads terminate before calling exitProfiling() in the parent thread. If the returned callable is not invoked, there is no effect on the system. The stack for the spawned thread will be returned by ProfilerStack.getSpawnedStacks(). If the returned callable is invoked in the same thread, an exception will be thrown by the Profiler.
      Parameters:
      entryPointTag -
      block -
      Returns:
      The new callable
